101.heading: Cardinal, Red.
101.title: "The Valentine Candy"
101.author: [No author]
101.series: Homer Pigeon) 6 p. in New Funnies, no. 97
notes: Summary: Homer loses his $5 on the way to buy candy for Carrie Pigeon. Red Cardinal finds the money, and buys the candy. The druggist hires Homer to deliver the candy to Carrie, and gives Homer a valentine card as payment. Red sabotages the delivery, not knowing the candy is the box he bought, and Carrie is happy with her valentine from Homer and nothing from Red.

147.heading: Cardoso Vargas, Hugo Arturo.
147.title: "Rosa y Federico : Novela Ilustrada Contemporánea : la Primera Novela Ilustrada Mexicana"
147.author: Hugo Arturo Cardoso Vargas
147.appears_in: p. 240-252 in Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios Sobre la Historieta, v. 2, no. 8 (Dic. 2002).
notes: Resumen: "Entre los múltiples trabajos desarrollados en torno a la historieta en México, a pesar de su abundancia no descubren ni menos describen la que vendría a ser la primera historieta publicada en las páginas de la prensa mexicana del siglo XIX. Entre otras razones porque fue publicada en las páginas del periódico de la ciudad de San Luis Potosí: La Ilustración Potosina. La historia de Rosa y Federico, hay que decirlo, no es una gran joya ni de la literatura ni de la litografía mexicana, pero su existencia es importante."

Abstract: In spite all the many works being published about the comic in Mexico, none have discovered or described what will be seen as the first comic published in the pages of the Mexican press in the 19th century. Among other reasons this is because it was published in the pages of the newspaper of the city of San Luis Potosi: La Ilustración Potosina. The story of Rosa y Federico, it must be said, is not a great jewel either of literature of the Mexican lithograph, but its existence is important.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.
Includes reprints of four pages of the story.
